New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook are the first pair of teammates to record 25-point triple-doubles in the same regular-season game in NBA history.
Key Match Events: Brooklyn led 20-12 five minutes in, even after Malone had taken an early timeout to wake up his team.
The Nuggets gradually built a 22-point lead only to lull themselves back to sleep. The score was suddenly 97-92 early in the fourth quarter.
Denver stretched to a 14-3 surge in the last six minutes to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone might never get over his phobia of short-handed draft lottery teams.
Malone went to Jalen Pickett for rotation minutes to combat foul trouble in the first half, with Christian Braun particularly endangered by three whistles.
After the break, Pickett was needed again as Jamal Murray felt soreness in his left knee and didnâ€™t return.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Malone said, 'We went through their personnel and I said, 'I'd bet a lot of money that most of you guys have never heard of some of these players or have any idea where they've played,' and 'If we think that we can just show up tonight and beat Brooklyn because a lot of their marquee names are out, then we'll lose.'
